qas.question: What country experienced a coup in 1962?
What country agreed to help suppress the Yemeni rebellion?
Which side of the civil war did Nasser side with?
In what year did Egypt leave Yemen's civil war?
How did Nasser characterize Egypt's involvement in Yemen's civil war?

context: Nasser's regional position changed unexpectedly when Yemeni officers led by Nasser supporter Abdullah al-Sallal overthrew Imam Badr of <a0_0>North Yemen<a0_0/> on 27 September 1962. Al-Badr and his tribal partisans began receiving increasing support from <a1_0>Saudi Arabia<a1_0/> to help reinstate the kingdom, while Nasser subsequently accepted a request by Sallal to militarily aid <a2_0>the new government<a2_0/> on 30 September. Consequently, Egypt became increasingly embroiled in the drawn-out civil war until it withdrew its forces in <a3_0>1967<a3_0/>. Most of Nasser's old colleagues had questioned the wisdom of continuing the war, but Amer reassured Nasser of their coming victory. Nasser later remarked in 1968 that intervention in Yemen was a "<a4_0>miscalculation<a4_0/>".
